solution_line_template: Coach A spent ${basketball_price}x {basketball_qty}=$<<{basketball_price}*{basketball_qty}={coach_a_total}>>{coach_a_total} for the 10 basketballs.
Coach B spent ${baseball_price}x{baseball_qty}=$<<{baseball_price}*{baseball_qty}={coach_b_baseballs_total}>>{coach_b_baseballs_total} for the 14 baseballs.
So, Coach B spent a total of ${coach_b_baseballs_total}+${bat_price}=$<<{coach_b_baseballs_total}+{bat_price}={coach_b_total}>>{coach_b_total} for the baseballs and a bat.
Thus, Coach A spent ${coach_a_total}-${coach_b_total}=$<<{coach_a_total}-{coach_b_total}={difference}>>{difference} more than coach B
